,TRUE,4,4,3,5,5 GBP_Chris","2022-07-27T17:52:44.837Z","Aaron Fox, Plus Assorted Parts","

These small NEXO Knights sets are an interesting assortment of pieces with an interesting and unique minifigure to tie it all together. Ultimate Aaron is no exception.

column4: tell you how to build the set.

column2: t have a particularly profound insight on Lego boxes.

column1: Ultimate Aaron comes with a variety of useful pieces. He has two stud shooters, a new crossbow, two green fins, a compound bow used earlier for Hawkeye (Marvel Super Heroes) and Soul Archer (Ninjago), a gunmetal helmet with goggles (The LEGO Movie), two A-beams in gray, four bananas, a NEXO shield, and three shield tiles. This is a nice assortment of useful parts.

Aaron is a fan-favorite character in show, and his set here reflects his livewire personality. The minifig torso and legs are very intricately detailed, the trans-green armor is a new shade, the helmet is a new design, and the visor is a new piece. If you attach the Arrow Strike arms to the back, put the crossbow in hand (which fires really well) and arm Aaron with the Arrow Strike shield, he looks like he'
Not the most sophisticated of builds, but creates a nice little display.
Great for display on a desk or another similar place. It conveys the NEXO Knights atmosphere and it'

In the end, this set is entirely about the minifigure and the parts selection. What you see is what you get, but for the sake of interesting pieces to add to your collection - not to mention a fun and over-the-top minifigure design.

column13: > Nexo Knights introduces a new style of powering up and additional play features compared to Ninjago or Legends of Chima. Ninjago gave us Spinners and the Airjitzu Gliders, Chima gave us the Speedorz and Nexo Knights has the Nexo Powers and an app game. So you get a selection of the main characters in these cheap sets that are designed to interact with the app for the young fans.

column8: >These reviews are going to focus on select aspects of these sets, as I do not have access to the phone app or the game the Nexo Powers will be mostly discussed as physical play features. On to the review.

>LEGO has finally learned how to make a decent packaging for these types of sets, the Spinners were pretty straightforward, but I recall that the Speedorz were terrible in their first year for having accessible packaging. There was a lot of ripping and destruction of cardboard just to access the contents.

>These packages are nice and simple cardboard sleeves that showcase the contents and advertise the game quite nicely. The colouring of dark blue helps to attract the eye, and the opening is much simpler than anything that has come before. The Ultimate Nexo Knights figures are easy to open and easy to keep the packaging intact without parts tossed all over the place.

>Aaron: Wearing a nice suit of rich green armour with transparent elements, this version of Aaron is fully powered for his battles against the monsters of this Theme. He looks pretty impressive, with a load of highly detailed printing on the front and back of his torso as well as leg printing.

>His face has two expressions, one is a regular smiling face and the other is a happy wide grin with closed eyes. The new helmet and armour piece used for these Nexo Knights is very impressive and I&rsquo
column9: m getting a lot of Ice Planet 2002 vibes from this Theme.

column8: >The display element for this figure is designed to house the Nexo Powers and the Minifigure for adequate display options. Each side houses one power and the central section is designed to hold the minifig while wearing the third accessory/power. Ultimately a fairly simple build which is the same in every set, and looks very nice and functional. Not the most thrilling thing to build, however it works for what it&rsquo

>Arrow Strike: The central Nexo Power features a large built up stud launcher inspired crossbow, instead of firing studs it shoots what basically amounts to drumsticks, thin rods with bulbs on the end that look like they could double as LEGO drumstick accessories for playing the drums. It&rsquo
column9: s pretty neat actually, and the massive backpack with twin stud launchers offers a lot of play value.

column8: >The crossbow build is a nice built-up weapon with a new holster/launching piece with mounts for other elements on either side. These studs are used here to bulk up the crossbow.

>Banana Bombs: This particular Nexo Power has a rather odd-looking play feature when it comes to physical armaments. Basically Aaron is given a handful of bananas to use as bombs and you swap out the clear green studs with white studs for the stud launchers. A pretty silly arsenal for him to use.

>Target Blaster: Physically changing Aaron with this Nexo Power involves leaving the stud launcher backpack on the back, swapping the shield, helmet and bow launcher for a regular Hawkeye-style bow and arrow weapon. Not much to play with here, but it does give younger fans more options to mix-and-match their Minifigures up.
>When it comes to Nexo Knights a lot of the sets are pretty much something you&rsquo
column9: ll like or something you won&rsquo
column11: re interested in the Minifigures for their parts or their unique prints these Ultimate figures offer up a pretty decent opportunity to collect and experience this Theme in small doses.

column8: >As far as fans of this theme go I&rsquo
column9: d say this is a pretty great way to collect the main heroes without spending too much money. Overall I&rsquo
column10: d recommend them for that reason, however I&rsquo
column11: d say that if you intend to get the most out of these actually using the App and playing the game would probably improve the overall enjoyment out of these sets.

When Nexo Knights was first introduced, I thought that it had big potential and I instantly downloaded the mobile game. Now after getting this set I see that this will come to be one of my favourite themes. Ultimate Aaron surely does deliver!
The box comes in a somewhat conical shape and I opened it from the bottom which I guess you could call a bit unconventional. It has a big image of Aaron along with the images of the three Nexo
column2: powers that come with this set.

column1:
,TRUE,5,5,5,5,5 Japanbuilder","2016-08-19T12:02:22.403Z","Arsenal to go? Sure! ","

This is my first look at an Ultimate Nexo Knight and I must say it was pretty exciting.
The box certianly does not raise expectations. It simply shows Aaron leaping into an off-camera frey.
Bananas. Lots and lots of bananas. And stud shooters and lots of green and blue parts plus 3 Nexo Powers.
Only one is included but it is great! Featuring a duel face and printing on the torso (front and back) and legs.
Given the very low parts count the build was not too complicated. It only took a few minutes to put together.
The completed model is a pretty cool display piece in its own right. Though for play it will likely not see too much use as the real draw is using Aaron to attack Jestro and his evil minions.
A great addition to your Nexo Knight team the included powers are also fairly respectable in the side App. The prints and armor look fantastic on Aaron and fit his persona to a T.

,TRUE,4,3,3,5,3 ZG_Brickfilms","2016-05-23T14:36:28.13Z","For the Older Fans ...","

Ultimate Aaron includes an exclusive minifig and three Nexo Shields that can be used in game. This all comes in one set that costs only ten dollars.GREAT DEAL!
The box for this set is not like most Lego boxes but instead is similar to the boxes that the Airjitzu fliers came in. The instruction book is small but east to follow.

My favorite part in the set is the arrow shooter. The set also includes two stud shooters as well. The set comes with one shield and three inserts for it. These inserts each have coding in it so it can be scanned into the game. I wish that they also included a set of the same shields in this set but without the coding. If they did this, people wouldn'
column2: t get the coding from seeing pictures of the completed set. &nbsp

column4: t get the shields in the game by scanning the box and not buying the set. However, when I do my video review of the set, people can scan my shields and get them for free. If the set also had blank shields, I would show them in the video review and people couldn&#39
column5: t take shields for free and not pay for them.)

column2: is Aaron. All his prints are new for 2016 and his armor features nice trans-green colors.

column1: The build is good and easy to put together.
The model is a stand for Aaron that displays all three shields. The shields can be scanned into the app and it gives you three power ups.

column2: Bomb- this sounds funny but is the best power in this set. It drops giant bombs of bananas. For every kill you make with this power, you gain life.&nbsp
